source_sentence: 佛說觀佛三昧海經卷第十
translation: Foshuo guanfo sanmei hai jing, vol. 10

source_sentence: 東晉天竺三藏佛陀跋陀羅譯
translation: A Translation of the Tripiṭaka of the Eastern Jin Dynasty (India) by Buddhabhadra

source_sentence: 念七佛品第十
translation: Tenth Chapter of Mindfulness of the Seven Buddhas

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「若有眾生觀像心成，次當復觀過去七佛像。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "If sentient beings observe the images with accomplished mind, they should then also observe the images of the seven buddhas of the past.

source_sentence: 觀七佛者當勤精進，晝夜六時勤行六法，端坐正受當樂少語，除讀誦經廣演法教，終不宣說無義之語，常念諸佛心心相續，乃至無有一念之間不見佛時，心專精故不離佛日。
translation: Those who contemplate the seven buddhas must diligently apply themselves, practice the six dharmas diligently during the six hours of the day and night, sit correctly and accept them, enjoy few words, never expound meaningless words except for reciting sūtras and expounding the teaching of the Dharma, and always remember the continuity of the buddhas' minds and hearts, even to the point where there's not a single moment of thought when the buddhas aren't seen, so their minds are focused and concentrated, and they don't part from the Buddha-days.

source_sentence: 「過去久遠有佛世尊，名毘婆尸佛，身高顯長六十由旬，其佛圓光百二十由旬，身紫金色八萬四千相，一一相中八萬四千好；一一好中無數金光；一一光中有恒沙化佛；一一化佛有恒沙色光；一一光中無數諸天、聲聞、比丘、菩薩大眾，以為侍者。
translation: "Once upon a time in the distant past, there was a Buddha, the Bhagavān Vipaśyin Buddha, whose body was 60 leagues long and tall, whose Buddha's circular radiance was 120 leagues long, whose body was purple-gold in color and had 84,000 features, and 84,000 beauties in each feature; in each beau there were countless golden lights; in each light there were incalculably transformed buddhas; in each transformed buddha there were incalculably colored lights; and in each light there were countless gods, śrāvakas, monks, and bodhisattvas in large numbers who served as attendants.

source_sentence: 人人各持一大寶華，華上皆有百千億寶摩尼網豔，網豔相次高百千丈以為佛光。
translation: Each of them carries a large, jeweled flower, and on top of that flower are a hundred thousand million precious mohair nets that are each a hundred thousand feet high in order to resemble the Buddha's radiance.

source_sentence: 是時佛身益更明顯，如百千日照紫金山，光明豔起化佛無數，一一化佛猶如百億日月俱出，令行者見。
translation: The Buddha's body then becomes even more visible, like a hundred thousand suns shining brightly on a purple mountain, and the number of transformation buddhas that appear in that light is countless, each one resembling one of the ten billion suns and moons that emerge together for the practitioner to see.

source_sentence: 毘婆尸佛偏袒右肩出金色臂摩行者頂告言：『法子！
translation: Vipaśyin Buddha bared his right shoulder, put his golden arm over the practitioner's head, and said, 'Dharma child!

source_sentence: 汝行觀佛三昧，得念佛心故我來證汝，汝今可觀我真色身，從一一相次第觀之，汝當至心立金剛誓，我等先昔行佛道時與汝無異。』
translation: Now, as you practice the samādhi of observing the Buddha and attain the mindfulness of the Buddha, I've come to realize for you that you can now observe my true form body and look at each of its aspects in turn.

source_sentence: 「爾時毘婆尸佛慰行人已，即時化作大寶蓮華如須彌山，佛在華上結加趺坐，為於行者說念佛念法，及說百億旋陀羅尼。
translation: "After Vipaśyin Buddha had comforted the practitioner, he immediately transformed into a large jeweled lotus like Mount Sumeru, and while sitting cross-legged on top of the lotus, the Buddha taught the practitioner the method of mindfulness of the Buddha and explained the ten billion revolving dhāraṇīs.

source_sentence: 行者見已倍加歡喜敬禮彼佛。
translation: When the practitioner saw this, he rejoiced and venerated the Buddha.

source_sentence: 彼佛告曰：『若有眾生聞我名者、禮拜我者，除却五百億劫生死之罪，汝今見我消除諸障，得無量億旋陀羅尼，於未來世當得作佛。』」
translation: The Buddha told him, 'If sentient beings hear my name and venerate me, they'll be freed from the sins of 50 billion eons of birth-and-death, and now that you've seen me remove the hindrances and attain measureless trillions of revolving dhāraṇīs, you'll become a buddha in a future life.'"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「爾時行者見毘婆尸心歡喜故，我與六佛現其人前。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "It was then that the practitioner saw Vipaśyin and rejoiced in his heart, and I and the six buddhas appeared before him.

source_sentence: 上座毘婆尸，為此法子說念佛三昧。
translation: Vipaśyin, the elder monk, taught this Dharma child the concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 尸棄世尊身長四十二由旬，身紫金色，圓光四十五由旬，通身光明一百由旬，其光網中無數化佛，及諸菩薩聲聞大眾，諸天眷屬以為圍遶，隨從佛後右旋宛轉。
translation: The Bhagavān Śikhin was forty-two leagues long, purple-gold in color, forty-five leagues in circular light, and one hundred leagues in total body radiance, and in his web of light were countless transformation buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, and members of the celestial retinue, all circling to his right and following him around.

source_sentence: 是時行者見尸棄佛，復更增益無量百千陀羅尼門；復更增廣得見百千無數化佛。
translation: When the practitioner sees Śīkya Buddha, he'll further enhance his knowledge of measureless hundreds of thousands of dhāraṇīs and further increase his ability to see hundreds of thousands of incalculable transformation buddhas.

source_sentence: 於未來世過算數劫，於其中間恒得值遇諸佛世尊，生菩薩家。」
translation: In a future life that lasts for countless eons, he'll always meet the world-honored buddhas and be born into a bodhisattva family."

source_sentence: 說是語時，復有無數百千天子，聞是事已見佛色身端嚴微妙，同時皆發三菩提心。
translation: When he spoke these words, measureless hundreds of thousands of celestials heard this and saw the Buddha's beautiful and subtle form and body, and they all aroused the three bodhisattva aspirations at the same time.

source_sentence: 「毘舍世尊舉身放光住行者前，其佛身長三十二由旬，圓光四十二由旬，通身光六十二由旬，身紫金色，光明威相如前無異。
translation: "The Bhagavān Vaiśravaṇa held up his body in front of the practitioners, and his body was thirty-two leagues long, with a circular light of forty-two leagues, a circular body light of sixty-two leagues, and a purple-golden body with the same radiant appearance as before.

source_sentence: 見此佛已復更增進諸陀羅尼三昧門，於未來世必定不疑生諸佛家。
translation: After seeing this Buddha, he'll further advance in the samādhi aspect of the dhāraṇīs, and in the future he'll surely have no doubts about being born into one of the Buddha's families.

source_sentence: 「拘留孫佛亦放光明住行者前，其佛身長二十五由旬，圓光三十二由旬，通身光五十由旬，相好具足如紫金山。
translation: "Kauśāmbī also radiates his radiance and stands in front of the practitioner, and his body is 25 leagues long, with a circular radiance of 32 leagues and a circular body radiance of 50 leagues, and his features are as complete as those of a purple gold mountain.

source_sentence: 見此佛者，常生淨國不處胞胎，臨命終時，諸佛世尊必來迎接。
translation: Those who see this Buddha will always be born in a pure land, won't be subject to retribution, and will be greeted by the world-honored buddhas when they reach the end of their lives.

source_sentence: 「拘那含牟尼佛放大光明住行者前，其佛身長二十由旬，圓光三十由旬，舉身光長四十由旬，光相具足。
translation: "Kanakamuni Buddha's magnificent radiance stands in front of the practitioner, and his body is 20 leagues long, his circular radiance is 30 leagues long, and his extended body radiance is 40 leagues long, replete with radiant features.

source_sentence: 見此佛者，即得百億諸三昧門無數陀羅尼。
translation: When someone sees this Buddha, they'll attain 10 billion incalculable dhāraṇīs of various samādhi approaches.

source_sentence: 若出定時，常得諸佛現前三昧，如此三昧證明行者，所以名諸佛現前三昧者。
translation: When he exits concentration, he always attains the samādhi of the buddhas in front of him, which is why it's called the samādhi of the buddhas in front of him when he proves his practice of this samādhi.

source_sentence: 得此三昧，出定、入定、行、住、坐、臥，恒得覩見一切諸佛，以妙色身現其人前。
translation: Attaining this concentration, when they emerge from and enter concentration, walk, stand, sit, and lay down, they'll always be able to see all the buddhas in their wonderfully shaped bodies before them.

source_sentence: 「迦葉世尊放大光明住其人前，佛長十六丈，身紫金色相好具足。
translation: "The Bhagavān Kāśyapa radiates his light and stands in front of him, and the Buddha is 16 feet long, with a body the color of purple-gold and replete with beautiful features.

source_sentence: 見此佛者，得寂滅光無言相三昧，於未來世恒住大空三昧海中。
translation: Those who see this Buddha will attain the concentration of the luminosity of cessation without speech and will abide in the ocean of the concentration of great emptiness throughout the future.

source_sentence: 「釋迦牟尼佛身長丈六，放紫金光住行者前。
translation: "The body of Śākyamuni Buddha is sixteen feet long, and he radiates a violet-gold light as he stands in front of the practitioner.

source_sentence: 彌勒世尊身長十六丈。
translation: The World Honored Maitreya's body is 16 feet long.

source_sentence: 如是諸佛各入普現色身三昧現其人前，令其行者心得歡喜，以歡喜故是諸化佛各申右手摩行者頂。
translation: Each of these buddhas enters the samādhi of the universally visible body and appears before him, causing him to rejoice, and it's because of that rejoicing that the transformation buddhas each extend their right hands to touch the practitioner's head.

source_sentence: 見七佛已見於彌勒，見彌勒已賢劫菩薩，一一次第逮及樓至，各放光明住行者前。
translation: After seeing the seven buddhas, they saw Maitreya, and after seeing Maitreya, the bodhisattvas of the good eon each one at a time grasped Rucika and each one radiated their light to stand in front of the practitioner.

source_sentence: 時千菩薩各各讚歎念佛三昧，及為行者說諸菩薩性、說諸菩薩解脫、說諸菩薩慧，是名因觀像心得念佛三昧。」
translation: Those thousand bodhisattvas then each praised the concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha and taught the practitioner the nature of the bodhisattvas, the liberation of the bodhisattvas, and the wisdom of the bodhisattvas, which is called the concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha that comes from observing images."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「佛滅度後佛諸弟子，如是觀者是名正觀，若異觀者名為邪觀。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Such observation by the Buddha's disciples after the Buddha's death is called right observation, and if they observe differently, it's called wrong observation.

source_sentence: 修此三昧者，雖具煩惱不為煩惱之所使也，以是念佛三昧力故，十方諸佛放大光明現其人前，光明無比三界特尊。」
translation: When someone cultivates this concentration, even though they have afflictions, they won't be subject to them. Because of the power of this concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha, the buddhas in the ten directions will shine brightly in front of them, and their light will be unsurpassed in the three realms."

source_sentence: 佛說是語已，時梵天王復更勸請：「願佛世尊！
translation: After the Buddha spoke these words, the Brahma gods again exhorted him, "May the Buddha be honored, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 說十方佛住行者前光明色相。」
translation: He says, 'The buddhas of the ten directions abide in front of the practitioner in radiant form.'"

source_sentence: 念十方佛品第十一
translation: Chapter 11 of the Chapter on Mindfulness of the Buddhas of the Ten Directions

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「云何行者觀十方佛？
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "How does a practitioner contemplate the buddhas of the ten directions?

source_sentence: 觀十方佛者：東方為始，東方有世界，國名寶安隱，無量億寶有億千色以用合成，佛號善德，亦放無數光普照百千國；亦與無數億分身諸化佛住於行者前。
translation: "He who observes the buddhas of the ten directions: 'The East is the beginning, and in the East there's a world called Jewel-Arrest, a world of measureless millions of treasures in measureless thousands of colors made up of functions, and a Buddha named Shande, who also radiates measureless light to illuminate a hundred thousand countries; he also lives in front of practitioners with measureless millions of transformation buddhas in separate bodies.

source_sentence: 身色如金山端嚴甚無比，坐大金剛窟，無數雜寶光莊嚴為堂閣，一一堂閣前無量微塵數百億諸寶樹；一一寶樹下八萬四千師子座；一一師子座有一分身佛，結加趺坐三昧坐於寶樹下。
translation: His body is shaped like a golden mountain of unsurpassed splendor, and he's sitting in a large adamantine cave decorated by the light of countless mixed treasures, in front of which are incalculably small tens of billions of jeweled trees; under each jeweled tree are 84,000 lion seats, and on each lion seat is a split-body Buddha sitting cross-legged in samādhi under a jeweled tree.

source_sentence: 善德佛世尊身長二百五十億那由他由旬，一一身毛孔無數億微塵一切勝相好；一一相好中有無數化佛；一一化佛高顯巍巍如須彌山，放大光明坐寶蓮華住虛空中。
translation: The body of the Bhagavān, the Buddha of Wonderful Virtue, is 25 billion nayutas and yojanas in length, and each of his pores has measureless millions of tiny particles of perfectly proportioned features; within each of those features are countless transformation buddhas, each of which stands tall and lofty like Mount Sumeru and radiates his radiance while sitting on a jeweled lotus in the sky.

source_sentence: 分身諸佛各各開現微妙光明，顯出無數百千化佛；一一化佛坐寶蓮華；一一蓮華有千幢幡；一一幢幡演出百億微妙音聲，是諸聲中教觀十方無數佛身。
translation: Each of these buddhas in their separate bodies emits a subtle light that reveals measureless hundreds of thousands of transformation buddhas, and each transformation buddha sits on a jeweled lotus, and each lotus has a thousand banners and streamers, each of which produces ten billion subtle sounds that teach the contemplation of the incalculable bodies of the buddhas in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 此相現時，見十方界猶如金剛，百億寶色不滅不壞，見此相已於諸佛前受法王子位，如是境界名性地菩薩。
translation: When this characteristic appears, he sees the world in ten directions as if it were adamantine, with ten billion precious colors that don't cease or break up, and after seeing this characteristic, he's accepted the position of prince of the Dharma before the buddhas, which is called the bodhisattva of the stage of nature in this realm.

source_sentence: 「南方栴檀德佛，身相高顯，其佛國土琉璃為地恒沙寶色，於佛光中亦有無數百千堂閣，寶樹行列敷師子座，座上諸佛結加趺坐，寶幢幡蓋說法音聲，如佛海三昧說。
translation: "In the south, the Buddha of Sandalwood has a towering body, and his land is made of lapis lazuli and the color of constant sand, and in his light there are measureless hundreds of thousands of halls and shrines, rows of precious trees spread out on a lion's seat, and on that seat the buddhas sit cross-legged with jeweled banners and canopies speaking the sounds of the Dharma as described in the Buddha Ocean samādhi.

source_sentence: 「西方無量明佛，國土清淨黃金為地，五百億寶色佛身光明，重閣講堂寶樹行列寶師子座，分身諸佛結加趺坐坐寶樹下，寶幢幡中亦說念佛海。
translation: "In the west, there's the Buddha of Immeasurable Light, whose land is made of pure gold and whose 50 billion jewel-colored buddha bodies shine brightly, whose lecture hall is lined with jeweled trees and has a jeweled lion seat, whose part-body buddhas sit cross-legged under a jeweled tree, and whose ocean of mindfulness of the buddhas is explained in a banner and banners.

source_sentence: 「北方相德佛，其地頗梨色，有五百億寶光，寶樹行列，寶師子座重閣講堂幢幡光明，與向無異。
translation: "In the north, the Xiangde Buddha's ground is quite pearly, and there are 50 billion precious lights, rows of precious trees, and a jeweled lion's seat with a banner and banners shining brightly from a pavilion and lecture hall, not dissimilar to those in the past.

source_sentence: 「東南方無憂德佛，其地七寶色，一一色上有七百億雜色，寶樹行列重閣光明百億萬種，一一光明說佛功德海，如佛海說。
translation: "In the southeast, the Buddha of No Sorrow has a ground that's seven treasures in color, seventy billion variegated colors on top of each other, and ten billion million kinds of light from rows of precious trees and pavilions, each of which illuminates the ocean of Buddha merit as described in the Buddha Ocean.

source_sentence: 「西南方寶施佛，其地五寶色，一一寶上五百億光明；一一光明化為五百億蓮華雲；一一蓮華雲上有百億重閣；一一重閣如百千萬億梵王宮；一一梵王宮中無數床座，光明蓮華所共合成，是諸座上有諸分身佛結加趺坐，演說諸佛大慈悲法，光明幢幡亦說佛海。
translation: "In the southwest, there's a five-jewel-colored Buddha whose ground is covered with 50 billion lights from each jewel, and each of those lights transforms into 50 billion lotus clouds; on top of each lotus cloud there are 10 billion pavilions; each of those pavilions is like the palace of 10,000,000,000,000 Brahmā kings; in each of those palaces there are countless seats made up of bright lotus flowers, and on those seats are part-body buddhas sitting cross-legged and expounding the great compassionate teachings of the buddhas, and their bright banners and streamers speak of the ocean of buddhas.

source_sentence: 「西北方華德佛，其佛國土琉璃頗梨色，一一色上有無數百千光；一一光化為五百億寶窟；一一窟中無數寶蓋；一一蓋中百億光明；一一光中無數分身佛，結加趺坐放大光明，其光明中說念佛三昧，因念佛三昧中，復更得見無數諸佛。
translation: "In the northwest, the Flower Power Buddha's land is a beryl color, and above each color there are measureless hundreds of thousands of lights; each light transforms into 50 billion jeweled caves; in each cave there are measureless jeweled lids; in each lid there are 10 billion lights; in each light there are measureless partial-body buddhas sitting cross-legged and magnifying their light, and in that light they teach the concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha, and because of that concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha, they can again see measureless buddhas.

source_sentence: 「東北方三乘行佛，其佛國土純白銀色百億萬光，光有千色，莊嚴國界極令清淨，分身化佛寶樹幢幡，行列莊嚴數不可知。
translation: "The northeastern Samyak-saṃbhava-buddha, whose land is pure white and silver in ten billion million lights, has a thousand colors of light, adorns the country's realm with an extremely pure, and has an unfathomable number of part-body transformation buddhas with jeweled trees, banners, and streamers that line up and adorn it.

source_sentence: 「上方廣眾德佛，其地五百億寶色，一一寶色無數光明；一一光明化為無數百億化佛；一一佛光中無量寶樹行列莊嚴；一一樹下百億寶師子座。
translation: "Above them is the Buddha of vast virtue, whose ground is 50 billion precious colors, each of which has measureless light; each of those lights transforms into measureless tens of billions of transformation buddhas; each of those buddhas is adorned by an infinite number of precious trees in procession in its light; and each of those trees has 10 billion precious lion seats beneath it.

source_sentence: 諸佛在上結加趺坐，無數菩薩以為侍者，一切大眾皆悉住佛光明雲中。
translation: With the buddhas sitting cross-legged on top, countless bodhisattvas serving as attendants, and all the people abiding in the buddha's cloud of light.

source_sentence: 「下方明德佛，其地金色、金光、金雲，於光雲中無數金堂七寶樓閣，百寶行樹羅列莊嚴。
translation: "Below is the Buddha of luminous virtue, whose ground is golden, with golden light and golden clouds, and within those clouds of light are countless golden halls, seven-jeweled mansions, and a hundred jeweled rows of trees arranged in an ornament.

source_sentence: 寶幢幡蓋數億千萬，一一樹下百億寶座諸堂樓閣，無數坐具狀如寶華，無數分身一切諸佛，坐寶樹下琉璃座上，眾華色間無數佛會。
translation: There are hundreds of millions of banners, banners and canopies, ten billion jeweled seats under each tree, halls and mansions, countless seating arrangements shaped like jeweled flowers, and countless part-bodies of all the buddhas sitting on beryl seats under jeweled trees, with countless buddha assemblies amidst the colors of flowers.

source_sentence: 是諸世尊皆悉講說菩薩行法，如是十方無數化佛，一一化佛顯現光明。
translation: Each of these world-honored ones explained the bodhisattva's practice, and thus in ten directions there were countless transformation buddhas, each one displaying their radiance.

source_sentence: 「時十方佛各各悉坐金剛窟中，身量光明如善德佛及諸化佛，威神國土令行者見，如於明鏡自見面像，了了分明，見十方佛心歡喜故，不染諸法住於初心。
translation: "The buddhas of the ten directions are each sitting in the cave of adamantine, their bodies shining brightly like the well-merited buddhas and the transformation buddhas, and their authoritative lands cause practitioners to see them as they see their own faces in a bright mirror, clearly and distinctly, and they rejoice at the sight of the buddhas of the ten directions, so they don't defile the teachings and abide in their first state of mind.

source_sentence: 時十方佛廣為行者各說相似六波羅蜜，聞是法已於初地下十心境界無有疑慮。
translation: The buddhas of the ten directions then explain to the practitioner the six paramitas in their own right, and after hearing this teaching, they have no doubts about the first subsurface realm of the ten states of mind.

source_sentence: 見此事者，必聞諸佛說般若波羅蜜，聞第一義空心不驚疑，於諸法中得入空三昧，是名相似空相三昧。」
translation: Those who see this must have heard the buddhas teach the perfection of wisdom, heard about the emptiness of the ultimate truth, and had no doubts at heart, and attained the samādhi of emptiness among all things, which is called the samādhi of similar emptiness."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「佛滅度後，佛諸弟子欲觀十方佛者，於念佛三昧中但知麁相，當自然知無量妙相。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "After the Buddha's death, if his disciples want to contemplate the buddhas of the ten directions, they'll simply know the crude aspects in the concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha and will naturally know the measureless subtle aspects.

source_sentence: 如是觀者是名正觀，若異觀者名為邪觀。
translation: Such observation is called right observation, and if one observes differently, it's called wrong observation.

source_sentence: 得此觀者見佛無數不可限量，入此定者名見一切諸佛色身，亦得漸漸入三空門。
translation: Attaining this contemplation, he sees an unlimited number of buddhas, and when he enters this concentration, he's called someone who sees the form bodies of all the buddhas and can gradually enter the three approaches to emptiness.

source_sentence: 遊此空者諸佛力故心不著空，於未來世當成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，得不退轉，是名不忘菩提之心正順佛道。」
translation: Those who wander through this emptiness are not attached to emptiness in their minds because of the power of the buddhas, and they will achieve unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment in the future without turning back, which is called not forgetting the mind of enlightenment and rightly following the Buddha's path."

source_sentence: 說觀十方佛時，十方佛坐金剛山百寶窟中，各申右手摩阿難頂告言：「法子！
translation: When he spoke of contemplating the buddhas of the ten directions, the buddhas of the ten directions sat in the cave of a hundred jewels on Vajragiri and each asked Ānanda to raise his right hand and tell him, "Dharma son!

source_sentence: 汝持佛語，為未來世諸眾生等，當廣宣說慎勿妄傳，當為堅發三菩提心行念佛定正受者說。」
translation: Hold on to the Buddha's words, and for all sentient beings in future generations, you must explain them widely and cautiously, and don't misrepresent them to those who firmly arouse the three bodhi-mind and practice the correct reception of mindfulness of the Buddha's concentration."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「此念佛三昧若成就者，有五因緣。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "If this concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha is accomplished, there are five causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 何等為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 一者、持戒不犯。
translation: One, he observes the precepts and doesn't violate them.

source_sentence: 二者、不起邪見。
translation: 2. doesn't give rise to wrong views.

source_sentence: 三者、不生憍慢。
translation: 3. doesn't become proud.

source_sentence: 四者、不恚不嫉。
translation: 4. doesn't become angry or jealous.

source_sentence: 五者、勇猛精進如救頭然。
translation: Five, he makes bold and vigorous effort like a savior.

source_sentence: 行此五事，正念諸佛微妙色身令心不退，亦當讀誦大乘經典，以此功德念佛力故，疾疾得見無量諸佛。
translation: Doing these five things and correctly mindful of the buddhas' subtle forms and bodies so that their minds don't regress, they should also recite the great vehicle sūtras, and because of this merit and the power of mindfulness of the buddhas, they'll quickly attain a view of measureless buddhas.

source_sentence: 「見諸佛者，獨一心淨不與他共，應當供養十方諸佛。
translation: "Those who see the buddhas should make offerings to the buddhas of the ten directions, singly purifying their minds and not sharing them with others.

source_sentence: 云何供養？
translation: How do I make offerings?

source_sentence: 是人出定、入塔見像、念持經時，若禮一佛當作是念：『正遍知諸佛心智無有限礙，我今禮一佛即禮一切佛；若思惟一佛即見一切佛；見一一佛前有一行者，接足為禮皆是己身。』
translation: When a person emerges from meditation, enters a stūpa, sees an image, or recites and maintains a sūtra, he should think, 'Correctly and universally knowing that the Buddha's mind and wisdom have no finite obstruction, I now venerate one Buddha as I venerate all the Buddhas; if I contemplate one Buddha, I see all the Buddhas; and when I see one practitioner in front of each Buddha, I take his feet and venerate them all as my own body.'

source_sentence: 若以一華供養佛時，當作是念：『諸佛法身功德無量，不住不壞湛然常安，我今以華奉獻諸佛，願佛受之。』
translation: When you offer a single flower to a Buddha, you should think, 'The buddhas' Dharma bodies have measureless merit and are uninterrupted, undecaying, and perfectly peaceful; now, I'll offer this flower to the buddhas and hope they'll accept it.'

source_sentence: 作是念已復當起想：『我所執華從草木生，持此供養可用擬想。』
translation: After having this thought, you should then contemplate, 'That flower I'm holding onto comes from grass and trees, so I can make an offering using this as a figurative image.'

source_sentence: 即當作想身諸毛孔，令一毛孔出無數華雲，以此華雲運想擬意供一切佛，一一佛上化成華臺諸佛受之，於十方界施作佛事，供養香時亦復如是！
translation: He then should contemplate the pores of his body, causing an incalculable cloud of flowers to emanate from one pore, and using that cloud of flowers, he should contemplate making offerings to all the buddhas, transforming each one into a flower dais that the buddhas accept, performing buddha-works in the ten directions, and making offerings of incense in the same way!

source_sentence: 香烟香雲於十方界施作佛事，作佛事已還成金臺在行者前。
translation: The clouds of fragrant smoke and incense are spread throughout the ten directions to perform Buddha-works, and after performing those Buddha-works, they are returned to form a golden dais in front of the practitioner.

source_sentence: 若凡夫人欲供養者，手擎香爐執華供養，亦當起意作華香想，當發是願：『願此華香滿十方界，供養一切佛、化佛并菩薩、無數聲聞眾，受此香華雲以為光明臺，廣於無邊界無邊作佛事。』
translation: If a woman who wants to make offerings holds a censer in her hand and carries flowers to make offerings, she must also give rise to the idea of making flowers and incense, and she must give rise to this vow: 'May this flowery incense fill the whole world in the ten directions, offer it to all the buddhas, transformation buddhas, bodhisattvas, and countless śrāvakas, and accept this fragrant cloud of flowers as a platform of light that will carry out Buddha-works in an infinite number of realms and without limit.'

source_sentence: 禮佛若坐禪，起是供養心，常當發是願。
translation: If you worship a buddha or sit in meditation, you must always give rise to this vow when you arouse this intention to make offerings.

source_sentence: 繒蓋、幢幡、音樂、偈頌，當作是願：『我今設此少分供具，願此供具遍供十方一切諸佛，諸佛受之，於幢幡中化光明雲；於妓樂中、偈頌之中演妙法音。』
translation: With silken canopies, banners, music, and verses, you should make this vow: 'Now, I've set up this small offering, hoping that it will be a universal offering to all the buddhas in the ten directions and that the buddhas will accept it as a cloud of light amidst banners and banners, and as a wonderful Dharma voice amidst music and verses.'

source_sentence: 作是願已坐時應想，令身毛孔一一孔中作無量幢幡想；一一幢幡中作無量偈頌雲想。
translation: When you sit down after making this vow, you should think, causing the contemplation of measureless banners and streamers in each pore of your body and measureless clouds of verses in each banner and streamer.

source_sentence: 作是想時心如香爐，流出金色香烟香雲，身毛孔中如好華樹，踊出阿僧祇無量雜華雲，是諸華雲，於十方界諸佛之上，化為一切諸供養具。
translation: When you contemplate this, your mind is like a censer, and golden clouds of fragrant smoke flow out of it; in your pores, like a good flower tree, clouds of incalculable mixed flowers spring up, and these clouds of flowers are transformed into all the offerings above the buddhas of the ten directions.

source_sentence: 爾時當於身心分中，起一切供養具想。
translation: At that point, you should give rise to the notion of all the articles of offerings in the physical and mental parts of your body.

source_sentence: 若得食飲、若施人一錢，當起空、無我想檀波羅蜜。
translation: If he gets something to eat or drink, or if he gives a penny to someone, he'll give rise to the notion of emptiness and selflessness, the perfection of giving.

source_sentence: 如是等無量供養，皆當起心從心想出，供養十方一切諸佛，是名坐時無量功德從心想海生。
translation: Such measureless offerings should arise from the mind and come out of mental conceptions to make offerings to all the buddhas in the ten directions, which is called the ocean of measureless merits that arises from mental conceptions when you sit.

source_sentence: 如是坐時，入深禪定無量境界諸三昧海，但於心中，出息、入息、念念想想相續不絕；於一心中運其心意，作無數供具雲。
translation: When they sit like this, they enter into the limitless realms of the ocean of samādhi in deep meditation, but in their minds, they continuously contemplate exhalation, inhalation, and mindfulness, making countless clouds of offerings.

source_sentence: 上供諸佛下施一切，作是念者名學普施。
translation: When he makes these offerings to the buddhas above and gives them to everyone below, this mindfulness is called training in universal giving.

source_sentence: 此想成時，漸漸減消諸煩惱結，觀法無相，無相力故，當得甚深六波羅蜜。」
translation: When this contemplation is accomplished, it gradually reduces the bonds of affliction, observes that things are without marks, and because of the power of no marks, it will attain the six profound perfections."

source_sentence: 觀佛密行品第十二
translation: The Twelfth Chapter of the Contemplation on the Buddha's Esoteric Practices

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「未來眾生其有得是念佛三昧者、觀諸佛相好者、得諸佛現前三昧者，當教是人密身口意，莫起邪命、莫生貢高。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "If there will be sentient beings in the future who attain this concentration of mindfulness of the Buddha, contemplate the Buddha's appearance, or attain the concentration of the Buddha's presence, you should teach that person to guard his or her body, speech, and mind so that they don't take wrong livelihoods or become arrogant.

source_sentence: 若起邪命及貢高法，當知此人是增上慢破滅佛法，多使眾生起不善心，亂和合僧顯異惑眾，是惡魔伴。
translation: If he gives rise to wrong livelihoods and arrogant attitudes, you should know that person is arrogant and destroys the Buddha's teaching, often causes sentient beings to develop unwholesome thoughts, and disturbs the harmony of the saṃgha by revealing differences and confusing the multitude, which is a bad companion of Māra.

source_sentence: 如是惡人，雖復念佛失甘露味，此人生處，以貢高故身恒卑小，生下賤家貧窮諸衰，無量惡業以為嚴飾，如此種種眾多惡事，當自防護令永不生。
translation: Even though this bad person is mindful of the Buddha and loses the taste of ambrosia, this person's place in life is to be humbled by pride, born into a lowly family with poor and declining fortunes, adorned by measureless bad deeds, and protected by these many bad deeds so that they won't arise again.

source_sentence: 若起如是邪命業者，此邪命業猶如狂象壞蓮華池，此邪命業亦復如是壞敗善根。」
translation: If someone thus engenders wrong life-karma, that wrong life-karma is like a mad elephant damaging a lotus pond, and so this wrong life-karma corrupts good roots."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「有念佛者，當自防護勿令放逸。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Those who are mindful of the Buddha should guard themselves so that they don't let themselves wander off.

source_sentence: 念佛三昧人，若不防護生貢高者，邪命惡風吹憍慢火燒滅善法。
translation: If someone who's mindful of the Buddha's concentration doesn't guard themselves and become arrogant, the bad wind of wrong livelihood will blow the fire of conceit and burn up the good Dharma.

source_sentence: 善法者：所謂一切無量禪定。
translation: The good dharma is called the innumerable meditations.

source_sentence: 諸念佛法從諸心想生，是名功德藏。」
translation: The mindfulness of the buddha-dharmas that arise from the thoughts of the mind is called a store of merit."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「譬如長者多財饒寶，唯有一子，長者自知將死不久，以諸庫藏委付其子。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Suppose an elderly man with lots of wealth and treasure has only one son, and he knows that he's going to die soon and entrusts his son with the treasury.

source_sentence: 其子得已隨意遊戲，忽於一時值有王難，無量眾賊從四面來，競取藏物不能遮護。
translation: After he gets it, his son plays with it as he wishes, but suddenly there's a time when the king is confronted by a myriad of thieves coming from all directions, vying for the treasury's contents and unable to protect them.

source_sentence: 惟有一金乃是閻浮檀那紫金，重十六兩，金挺長短亦十六寸，此金一兩價直餘寶百千萬兩，為賊所逼無奈金何，即以穢物纏裹真金置泥團中，眾賊見已不識是金脚踐而去。
translation: When the thieves forced him to do so, he wrapped a piece of real gold in filth and placed it in a ball of mud.

source_sentence: 賊去之後財主得金心大歡喜。
translation: After the thieves left, the wealthy man was overjoyed to get the gold.

source_sentence: 念佛三昧亦復如是，當密藏之。」
translation: This is likewise with the samādhi of mindfulness of the Buddha, which you should store in secret."

source_sentence: 「復次阿難！
translation: "Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 譬如有人貧窮薄福，依諸豪賢以存性命。
translation: Suppose there's a person who's poor and has little fortune, and they rely on some noble men to save their life.

source_sentence: 時有王子，遇行出遊執大寶瓶，於寶瓶內藏王印綬。
translation: A prince then meets a traveling traveler who carries a large precious vase and hides the king's seal inside the vase.

source_sentence: 是時貧者詐來親附，得王寶瓶擎持逃走。
translation: The poor man then fraudulently comes to join him, gets the king's precious vial, carries it, and flees.

source_sentence: 王子覺已，遺六大兵乘六黑象，手執利劍疾往追之。
translation: When the prince realized this, he left six large soldiers riding on six black elephants with sharp swords in their hands and raced after them.

source_sentence: 時持瓶人，走入深草空野澤中，見曠野澤滿中毒蛇，四面吐毒吸持瓶者。
translation: The man holding the vial then went into a deep, grassy, empty swamp and saw a wilderness full of vipers spitting poison on all sides to suck the man holding the vial.

source_sentence: 時貧窮人慞惶驚怖馳走東西，蛇亦隨之無藏避處，於空澤中見一大樹，蓊蔚扶踈甚適其意，頭戴寶瓶攀樹而上。
translation: The poor man then rushed east and west in fear and panic, followed by the snakes, who had no place to hide.

source_sentence: 既上樹已，六兵乘象駃疾如風尋復來至，貧人見已吞王寶印，持瓶冠頭以手覆面，坐貪惜故不忍見之。
translation: After he had climbed up the tree, six soldiers riding on an elephant as fast as the wind came back, and after seeing them, the poor man swallowed the king's precious seal, held the vase over his head, and covered his face with his hand, sitting there in greed, so he couldn't bear to look at it.

source_sentence: 時六黑象以鼻絞樹令樹倒躄，貧人落地身體散壞唯金印在，寶瓶現光諸蛇見光四散馳走。」
translation: The six black elephants then twisted the tree with their trunks, causing it to fall down and cripple him. The poor man's body fell to the ground and was scattered, except for the gold seal, and the precious vial shone brightly as snakes scattered and ran away when they saw the light."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「住念佛者心印不壞，亦復如是！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "So it is when the mind-seal of someone who abides in mindfulness of the Buddha doesn't break down!

source_sentence: 「復次阿難！
translation: "Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 譬如長者多饒財寶，無諸子息唯有一女。
translation: Suppose an elderly man has a lot of wealth and possessions, but has no children and only one daughter.

source_sentence: 是時長者年過百歲，自知朽邁將死不久：『我此財寶無男兒故財應屬王。』
translation: That man is more than a hundred years old and knows that he's going to die soon, 'This treasure of mine has no male children, so the treasure should belong to the king.'

source_sentence: 作是思惟，喚其女子密告之言：『今有妙寶寶中上者當用遺汝，汝得此寶密藏令堅莫令王知。』
translation: Thinking thus, he summoned the woman and told her, 'Now, there's a wonderful baby, the best of the best, that you will use to bequeath to you; keep this treasure hidden and hard, and don't let the king know about it.'

source_sentence: 女受父勅，持摩尼珠及諸珍寶藏之糞穢，室家大小皆亦不知。
translation: Following her father's command, she took the maṇi beads and other treasures and hid them in a dung heap, without informing anyone in her household or large.

source_sentence: 值世飢饉女夫告妻：『我家貧窮困於衣食，汝可他行求自活處。』
translation: When the world was starving, her husband told his wife, 'My family is poor and destitute of food and clothing; you can find a place to live by practicing other things.'

source_sentence: 妻白夫言：『我父長者臨命終時，以寶賜我，今在某處君可取之。』
translation: The wife said to her husband, 'My father, the elder, gave me this treasure when he was dying, and now there's a place where you can take it.'

source_sentence: 時夫掘取大獲珍寶并如意珠，持如意珠，燒香禮拜先發願言：『為我雨食。』
translation: The husband then dug up the great treasure he had obtained and the wish-granting jewel, held the wish-granting jewel, burned incense and venerated it, and vowed, 'Rain food for me!'

source_sentence: 隨語即雨百味飲食，如是種種隨意得寶。
translation: Following his words, it rained down a hundred flavors of food and drink, and he obtained these kinds of treasures at will.

source_sentence: 時夫得已告其妻言：『卿如天女能賜我寶，汝藏此寶我尚不知，況復他人？』」
translation: After he obtained them, the man told his wife, 'You're like a goddess who can give me treasure; how could I not know you've hidden this treasure, let alone another person?'"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「念佛三昧堅心不動，亦復如是！
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "So it is when the mindfulness samādhi of a buddha is resolute and unmoving!

source_sentence: 「復次阿難！
translation: "Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 譬如有王暴虐違道，民罹其毒人怨神怒，國大亢旱求請神祇不能得雨。
translation: Suppose there's a king who tyrannizes and disobeys the Way, and the people are so poisoned that people resent the gods and become angry, and the country experiences a great drought and asks the gods for help, but they can't get rain.

source_sentence: 有臣白言：『大王當知，今此境內林藪之中，有一仙士五通無礙，王可祈請令其呪龍。』
translation: A minister said, 'Your majesty knows that there's an immortal in the forest within this region who has the five powers and is unimpeded; the king can pray to have him curse a dragon.'

source_sentence: 大王聞已欣踊無量，遣人詣林祈請仙人。
translation: The king was elated and overjoyed when he heard that, so he sent someone to the forest to pray to the sage.

source_sentence: 神仙飛往大王殿前，高聲唱言：『大王無道，諸天龍神皆四散去不護王國，云何使我令請雨也？』
translation: The sage flew to the king's palace and called out in a loud voice, 'The great king has no path, and the gods and dragons have scattered and aren't protecting the kingdom; how did I get them to call for rain?'

source_sentence: 王聞此語極懷慚愧，改悔先行所作惡事。
translation: Hearing this, the king felt a deep sense of shame and repented of the bad deeds he'd done in the past.

source_sentence: 仙人知王心已軟善，應念誦呪，神通力故天降甘露，地出湧泉潤澤一切。」
translation: The sage knew that the king's mind had softened and become good, so he should recite the spell, and because of his supernormal powers the gods rain down sweet dew and the earth wells up springs to moisten everything."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「欲念佛者如王棄惡，得念佛者如善呪人。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Suppose he wants to mind the Buddha as the king abandons evil, and he attains mindfulness of the Buddha as a well-versed man.

source_sentence: 「復次阿難！
translation: "Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 譬如力士自恃大力數犯王法，王遣五人收捕力士幽閉囹圄。
translation: It's like a strong man who relies on his strength to violate the king's laws several times, and the king sends five men to arrest the strong man and put him in prison.

source_sentence: 五處枷鎖極令牢固，奮力大怒舉體血現，枷鎖摧折踰牆逃逝，到海岸邊解髻明珠持雇船師，船師語言：『如此白石海中無數，我用是為？』
translation: When he is enraged, he raises his body in blood, breaks the chains, passes through the wall, and flees. He goes to the shore, unties his topknot, carries the pearl, and hires the boat captain, who says, 'There are countless white stones in the ocean.

source_sentence: 力士長跪白船師言：『我此明珠有六種色。』
translation: The strong man knelt down and said to the boat master, 'This bright pearl of mine has six different colors.'

source_sentence: 即以黃繒裹珠置之水中，水即金色；復還收珠以白繒裹置之水中，水即變白；收取復以綠繒裹置之水中，水色變作綠琉璃色；收取以碧繒裹置之水中，水即變作真金精色；收取復以絳繒裹置之水中，水即變作車璩色；收取復以紫繒裹置之水中，水即變成天金剛色，水上復有紫摩尼光。
translation: He then wrapped a yellow silica around the pearl and placed it in the water, and the water turned golden; he then returned and wrapped a white silica around the pearl and placed it in the water, and the water turned white; he then collected and wrapped a green silica around the pearl and placed it in the water, and the water turned green and lapis lazuli; he then collected and wrapped a blue silica around the pearl and placed it in the water, and the water turned the color of real gold; he then collected and wrapped a purple silica around the pearl and placed it in the water, and the water turned the color of the celestial adamantine, and there was a purple maṇi light on the water.

source_sentence: 船師見已，即取寶珠以大寶輿，輿勇猛士置大船上，望風舉帆疾如射箭到於彼岸。
translation: After he saw this, the captain of the boat took a precious pearl, placed it on a large, jeweled palanquin, and carried it aboard a large boat with a brave man aboard, looked into the wind, raised his sail, and quickly reached the other shore like shooting an arrow.

source_sentence: 到彼岸已，心意泰然安隱無懼，大取珍寶報船師恩。」
translation: When he reached the other shore, his mind was calm and collected, peaceful, and fearless, and he took great treasures in return for the shipmaster's kindness."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「行念佛者如大力士，挽心王枷鎖到慧彼岸。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Someone who practices mindfulness of the Buddha is like a vigorous man who takes the king's chains off his mind and reaches the other shore of wisdom.

source_sentence: 「復次阿難！
translation: "Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 譬如劫欲盡時二日竝出，山林樹木河池枯涸；三日出時，眾色火起；四日出時，大海消減三分留一；五日出時，大海竭盡；六日出時，須彌崩倒；七日出時，大地烔然乃至色界，唯金剛山不可摧破還住本際。
translation: When three suns arise, fires of many kinds arise; when four suns arise, the ocean is reduced by three parts and left by one; when five suns arise, the ocean is exhausted; when six suns arise, Sumeru collapses; and when seven suns arise, the whole earth is heated and even the form realm is left indestructible, except for Mount Vajra, which remains at its original location.

source_sentence: 念佛三昧亦復如是，行是定者，住過去佛實際海中。」
translation: So it is with mindfulness of the buddha samādhi; someone who practices this concentration will abide in the ocean of the Buddha's reality in the past."

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「吾今欲與十方諸佛報念佛三昧恩。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "Now, I want to repay the kindness of mindfulness of the buddha samādhi to the buddhas of the ten directions."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說是語已，及十方諸佛賢劫菩薩，入一切色身光明三昧。
translation: After the Bhagavān spoke these words, he and the bodhisattvas of the good eons in the ten directions entered the concentration of the radiance of all form bodies.

source_sentence: 時諸佛身一一毛孔，踊出眾多不可稱數妙化佛雲，是諸化佛結加趺坐住立空中。
translation: From every pore of the buddhas' bodies then sprang forth a multitude of incalculably beautiful clouds of transformation buddhas, which were sitting cross-legged and standing in the air.

source_sentence: 如是無數一切化佛，各申右手摩阿難頂，及勅釋提桓因：「汝等二人持是妙法慎莫忘失，為未來世濁惡眾生滅眾罪障故。
translation: Thus, countless numbers of these transformation buddhas raised their right hands on Ānanda's head and commanded Śakrodevānām-Indra, "You two should maintain this wonderful teaching and not forget it, for the sake of removing the numerous hindrances of sins for the sake of turbid and unwholesome sentient beings in future generations.

source_sentence: 如來正遍知今於大眾中說一切佛身相。」
translation: The Tathāgata perfectly and universally knows that he's now explaining all the characteristics of the Buddha's body to the public."

source_sentence: 爾時尊者阿難即從座起，頂禮佛足白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Ānanda then rose from his seat, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 當何名此經？
translation: What will be the name of this sūtra?

source_sentence: 此法之要當云何持？」
translation: How should the essentials of this teaching be maintained?"

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「此經名『繫想不動』，如是受持；亦名『觀佛白毫相』，如是受持；亦名『逆順觀如來身分』；亦名『一一毛孔分別如來身分』；亦名『觀三十二相八十隨形好諸智慧光明』；亦名『觀佛三昧海』；亦名『念佛三昧門』；亦名『諸佛妙華莊嚴色身』；亦名『說戒、定、慧、解脫、解脫知見、十力、四無所畏、十八不共法，果報所得微妙色身經』，汝好受持，慎勿忘失。」
translation: 佛告阿難：「此經名『繫想不動』，如是受持；亦名『觀佛白毫相』，如是受持；亦名『逆順觀如來身分』；亦名『一一毛孔分別如來身分』；亦名『觀三十二相八十隨形好諸智慧光明』；亦名『觀佛三昧海』；亦名『念佛三昧門』；亦名『諸佛妙華莊嚴色身』；亦名『說戒、定、慧、解脫、解脫知見、十力、四無所畏、十八不共法，果報所得微妙色身經』，汝好受持，慎勿忘失。」

source_sentence: 佛說是語時，比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷，及菩薩大眾、天龍八部、一切鬼神，聞佛說是微妙身相，有得須陀洹、斯陀含、阿那含、有得阿羅漢者，有種辟支佛道因緣者，有發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心者，有得無生法忍者，數甚眾多不可稱說。
translation: When the Buddha spoke these words, the monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen, the bodhisattvas, the eight groups of gods and dragons, and all the spirits who heard what he said about this exquisite body shape, some who had attained stream entry, once-returner, non-returner, arhat, those who had planted the causes and conditions of the pratyekabuddha path, those who had aroused the mind of unsurpassed, samyak-saṃbodhi, and those who had attained the ninjas of the unborn Dharma were too numerous to mention.

source_sentence: 時諸大眾聞佛說法恭敬頂禮，奉行佛語作禮求退。
translation: The large crowd then heard the Buddha preach, venerated him, approved of his words, paid homage, and asked to be excused.

source_sentence: 是時阿難即從座起，合掌長跪白言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda then rose from his seat, put his palms together, knelt down, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如來今者一切身相皆已說竟，唯不顯說無見頂相。
translation: Now, the Tathāgata has explained all the body parts, but he won't reveal the invisible head part.

source_sentence: 唯願天尊！
translation: Venerable gods!

source_sentence: 少說頂相光明瑞應，令未來世凡愚眾生知佛勝相。」
translation: He spoke little of the auspicious response of the radiant light at the top of the head, so that ordinary and foolish sentient beings in future generations would know the Buddha's excellent attributes."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即入頂三昧海，令佛頂上肉髻之中一一毛孔踊出琉璃光，其光如水蠡文右旋，遍滿十方無數世界，如百億世界微塵數海，如是八萬四千諸毛髮中，皆出是水相；一一水相復過是百千萬倍數不可知。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān entered the ocean of peak samādhi, causing a beryl light to spring from every pore in the top of the Buddha's head in a tuft of flesh, and that light, like a calabash, swirled to the right and filled measureless worlds in the ten directions, like a sea of dust in ten billion worlds, and such 84,000 hairs of hair as this, all of which had this watery appearance; each watery appearance was a hundred thousand million times greater than can be known.

source_sentence: 是諸琉璃水上，生眾多天寶蓮華，華有無數百千億葉，葉作無數百千億寶色，葉極小者遍覆三千大千世界。
translation: On these beryl waters there arises a multitude of divine lotus flowers with incalculably hundreds of billions of leaves that are made of incalculably hundreds of billions of precious colors, and the very smallest of those leaves covers a world of 3,000,000 great one-thousand worlds.

source_sentence: 如是華上，一一鬚間有無量阿僧祇百千萬億恒河沙化佛；一一化佛頂肉髻相，流出眾光亦復如是。
translation: On top of each of these flowers, there are measureless incalculable hundreds of thousands of trillions of rhesus transformational buddhas between their beards, and each transformational buddha has a protuberance on his or her head that radiates a multitude of lights in the same way.

source_sentence: 時諸佛身量同虛空不可得知；如是諸佛，佛佛相次盡世界海際。
translation: The buddhas' bodies are as large as space and cannot be discerned, and thus their buddha-body appearances next exhaust the world at the limit of the ocean.

source_sentence: 此相現時，於十方面，各有百億微塵數菩薩，身昇虛空現大神變，至釋迦牟尼佛所。
translation: When this characteristic appeared, ten billion dusty bodhisattvas in each of the ten directions ascended into space and performed a great miraculous transformation, reaching Śākyamuni Buddha.

source_sentence: 時諸菩薩以佛神力故，暫見一毛孔中少分瑞相，應時即得無量百千金剛相陀羅尼。
translation: Because of the Buddha's miraculous power, the bodhisattvas momentarily saw a tiny bit of the auspicious appearance in one pore, and then they immediately attained the dhāraṇī of measureless hundreds of thousands of vajra marks.

source_sentence: 佛現是相時，賢劫千菩薩及十方諸佛皆現此相。
translation: When the Buddha showed this characteristic, a thousand bodhisattvas of the good eon and buddhas in ten directions all showed this characteristic.

source_sentence: 時會大眾見此少分相者，須陀洹人如剎那頃成阿羅漢；觀因緣者不緣諸緣成阿羅漢；發心菩薩超越境界，增進甚深三昧海門住於性地；無生菩薩倍加增進無量勝法，住首楞嚴三昧。
translation: When the assembly saw this rare appearance, the stream-winner became an arhat in a moment's time; the meditator became an arhat without any conditions; the aroused bodhisattva transcended the objective realm, advanced to the profound concentration ocean gate, and abided in the nature stage; and the unborn bodhisattva doubled his advancement to measureless superior dharmas and abided in the śūraṃgama samādhi.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「佛滅度後濁惡世中，若有眾生聞佛勝相，心不驚疑不生怖畏，當知是人能滅一切煩惱業障。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "If sentient beings in a turbid and evil world hear of the Buddha's surpassing features and don't become frightened or doubtful, that person should be known to be able to extinguish all afflictive karmic hindrances.

source_sentence: 聞佛勝相生隨喜者，除却千億劫極重惡業，後世生處，不落三塗不生八難處。」
translation: Those who rejoice when they hear the Buddha's excellent features will be freed from a hundred billion eons of extremely heavy bad karma and will be born in a later life where they won't fall into the three destinies and won't be born in the eight difficult places."

source_sentence: 佛說是語時，長老憍陳如等諸大比丘，彌勒等諸大菩薩、無量大眾，聞佛所說，皆大歡喜，頂戴奉行。
translation: When the Buddha spoke these words, the eldest monk Kauṇḍinya and other great monks, Maitreya and other great bodhisattvas, and measureless multitudes of people who heard what he taught rejoiced greatly, put their heads together, and approved.

source_sentence: 佛說觀佛三昧海經卷第十
translation: Foshuo guanfo sanmei hai jing roll 10
